dotConnect for MySQL support@devart.com
Readme  

Product Description

dotConnect for MySQL, formerly known as MySQLDirect .NET or MyDirect .NET, is an enhanced data provider for MySQL that builds on ADO.NET technology to present a complete solution for developing MySQL-based database applications. As part of the Devart database application development framework, dotConnect for MySQL offers both high performance native connectivity to the MySQL database and a number of innovative development tools and technologies. dotConnect for MySQL introduces new approaches for designing application architecture, boosts productivity, and leverages database application implementation.

dotConnect for MySQL is a scalable data access solution developed with wide adaptability in mind. It can be successfully used in WinForms, ASP.NET, two-tier, multi-tier applications; within the ASP.NET Provider Model; in conjunction with the Enterprise Library; under .NET Compact Framework, Mono Framework and so on. Depending on the edition you choose, dotConnect for MySQL can be used as powerful ADO.NET data provider, or an effective application development framework.

Requirements

Prior to running Setup to install the dotConnect for MySQL, you must already have the .NET Framework 2.0, 3.0, or 3.5 installed on the computer. If the .NET Framework is not installed, the Setup program for the provider will fail.

Data provider can access MySQL server either using native MySQL network protocol directly or through MySQL client library. It allows you to create lightweight and fast applications working with MySQL.

Installation

dotConnect for MySQL is provided as single setup package that contains all required files and documentation. By default all files are installed in "Program Files\Devart\dotConnect\MySQL" folder. The setup program also adds the necessary assemblies to the Global Assembly Cache.

If you have problems with registering dotConnect for MySQL components in IDE toolbox, refer to corresponding topic in dotConnect for MySQL documentation.

Documentation and Informational Resources

dotConnect for MySQL has exhaustive documentation integrated into IDE, where every aspect of using the product is covered in details. The documentation contains reference information and set of articles that enlight most of dotConnect for MySQL features. You can also download the documentation in chm format from our site.

If you have a question regarding dotConnect for MySQL, take a look through list of Frequently Asked Questions. Common problems with viewing documentation are described there as well.

There is a forum dedicated to dotConnect for MySQL.

Getting Support

If your problem is not covered in documentation or FAQ, consult the Getting Support topic of dotConnect for MySQL documentation prior to contacting the support team through the forum or e-mail.
